com.seagate.kinetic.client

Interface KineticClient

  • All Superinterfaces:
    GenericKineticClient

    public interface KineticClient
extends GenericKineticClient
    Kinetic Client Application Interface.

    Applications use KineticClientFactory to construct new instances of KineticClient. All application level operations use this interface to communicate with the Kinetic service.

    The Kinetic API provide synchronous and asynchronous operations.

    For each synchronous operation, the operation is guaranteed to be successfully performed on server if the call returns without an Exception being raised.

    For example, an entry is persisted on server if put() operation returned successfully.

    For each asynchronous operation, the operation is guaranteed to be successfully performed on server if its callback handler's onSuccess() method received an successful CallBackResult.

    Each KineticClient instance supports concurrent operations. Each method in the KineticClient class also supports concurrent operations.

    Author:
    James Hughes., Chiaming Yang
    See Also:
    KineticClientFactory, CallbackHandler

    • Method Detail

      • put

        Entry put(Entry entry,
        byte[] newVersion)
          throws KineticException
        Put the specified Entry entry to the persistent store. Replace the version in the store with the new version. If the version in the specified entry does not match the version stored in the persistent store, a KineticException is thrown.

        The specified entry is guaranteed to be persisted in the store if the call returns successfully.

        The entry may or may not be persisted successfully if an Exception is raised. Applications may retry the put() operation or use the get() operation to determine the state of the previous unsuccessful put() status.

        Applications may force put the entry with putForced(Entry) API. An existed entry in the store is over-written if the key matches the entry in the store.

        Applications may use asynchronous put operation to put entry asynchronously. The result of the asynchronous operation is delivered to the application's CallbackHandler.onSuccess() method.

        Parameters:
        entry - the entry to be put to the persistent store.
        newVersion - the new version for the specified Entry.
        Returns:
        a shallow copy of the specified entry but the value of version in the entry metadata is set to the new version.
        Throws:
        KineticException - if any internal error occurred.
        See Also:
        putForced(Entry), putForcedAsync(Entry, CallbackHandler), putAsync(Entry, byte[], CallbackHandler), CallbackHandler, CallbackResult

      • putForced

        Entry putForced(Entry entry)
                throws KineticException
        Put the specified Entry to the persistent store. Force to overwrite the entry in the store if existed.

        The specified entry is guaranteed to be persisted in the store if the call returns successfully.

        The entry may or may not be persisted successfully if an Exception is raised. Applications may retry the put() operation or use the get() operation to determine the state of the previous put() status.

        Parameters:
        entry - the entry to be put to the persistent store.
        Returns:
        the same entry reference as specified in the parameter.
        Throws:
        KineticException - if any internal error occurred.
        See Also:
        put(Entry, byte[]), putForcedAsync(Entry, CallbackHandler), putAsync(Entry, byte[], CallbackHandler)

      • putAsync

        void putAsync(Entry entry,
            byte[] newVersion,
            CallbackHandler<Entry> handler)
              throws KineticException
        Put the versioned Entry asynchronously. If the version in the specified entry does not match the version stored in the persistent store, a KineticException is delivered to the callback instance.
        Parameters:
        entry - the Entry to be put to the persistent store.
        newVersion - new version for the entry.
        handler - callback handler for this operation.
        Throws:
        KineticException - if any internal errors occurred.
        See Also:
        putForced(Entry), put(Entry, byte[]), putForcedAsync(Entry, CallbackHandler)

      • putForcedAsync

        void putForcedAsync(Entry entry,
                  CallbackHandler<Entry> handler)
                    throws KineticException
        Force to put the specified Entry asynchronously. Overwrite the entry in the store if existed.
        Parameters:
        entry - the Entry to be put to the persistent store.
        handler - callback handler for this operation.
        Throws:
        KineticException - if any internal errors occurred.
        See Also:
        putForced(Entry), put(Entry, byte[]), putAsync(Entry, byte[], CallbackHandler)

      • get

        Entry get(byte[] key)
          throws KineticException
        Get the Entry entry associated with the specified key.

        Applications may use other variations of this API to perform get() operation. For example, getAsync(byte[], CallbackHandler)

        Parameters:
        key - the key used to obtain the entry.
        Returns:
        the Entry in the persistent store if there is a match. Otherwise, returns null.
        Throws:
        KineticException - if any internal error occurred.
        See Also:
        Entry, getAsync(byte[], CallbackHandler)

        Parameters:

        handler - get operation asynchronous callback handler
        Throws:

      • delete

        boolean delete(Entry entry)
               throws KineticException
        Delete the entry that is associated with the key specified in the entry. Applications may also use other variations of this API to perform deletion of an entry. For example, deleteForced(byte[]) or deleteAsync(Entry, CallbackHandler), etc.
        Parameters:
        entry - the key in the object is used to find the associated entry.
        Returns:
        true if entry is found and deleted. Otherwise, return false.
        Throws:
        KineticException - if any internal error occurred.
        See Also:
        deleteForcedAsync(byte[], CallbackHandler), deleteForced(byte[]), deleteAsync(Entry, CallbackHandler)

      • deleteForced

        boolean deleteForced(byte[] key)
                     throws KineticException
        Force to delete the entry in the store that is associated with the specified key ignoring the version information of the entry.

        Parameters:
        key - the key used to find the associated entry.
        Returns:
        true if operation is successfully returned from server. Server does not check if entry exists in store.
        Throws:
        KineticException - if any internal error occurred.
        See Also:
        delete(Entry), deleteAsync(Entry, CallbackHandler), deleteForcedAsync(byte[], CallbackHandler)

      • deleteAsync

        void deleteAsync(Entry entry,
               CallbackHandler<Boolean> handler)
                 throws KineticException
        Delete the entry that is associated with the key specified in the entry asynchronously. The version specified in the entry metadata must match the one stored in the persistent storage. Otherwise, a KineticException is raised.
        Parameters:
        entry - the key in the entry is used to find the associated entry.
        handler - the callback handler for the asynchronous delete operation.
        Throws:
        KineticException - if any internal error occurred.
        See Also:
        delete(Entry), deleteForced(byte[]), deleteForcedAsync(byte[], CallbackHandler)

      • deleteForcedAsync

        void deleteForcedAsync(byte[] key,
                     CallbackHandler<Boolean> handler)
                       throws KineticException
        Force delete the entry that is associated with the key specified in the parameter asynchronously, ignoring the entry version stored in the persistent store.
        Parameters:
        key - the key in the entry is used to find the associated entry.
        handler - the callback handler for the asynchronous delete operation.
        Throws:
        KineticException - if any internal error occurred.
        See Also:
        delete(Entry), deleteAsync(Entry, CallbackHandler), deleteForced(byte[])

        See Also:

      • getKeyRange

        List<byte[]> getKeyRange(byte[] startKey,
                       boolean startKeyInclusive,
                       byte[] endKey,
                       boolean endKeyInclusive,
                       int maxKeys)
                         throws KineticException
        Get a list of keys in the sequence based on the specified key range.
        Parameters:
        startKey - the start key in the specified key range.
        startKeyInclusive - true if the start key is inclusive.
        endKey - the end key in the specified key range.
        endKeyInclusive - true if the start key is inclusive.
        Returns:
        a list of keys in the sequence based on the specified key range. If maxKeys is larger than the number of keys in the range, only the number of keys in the range will be returned. If the number of keys in the range is larger than maxKeys, then only maxKeys keys will be returned.
        Throws:
        KineticException - if any internal error occurred.
        See Also:
        getKeyRangeAsync(byte[], boolean, byte[], boolean, int, boolean, CallbackHandler)

      • getKeyRangeAsync

        void getKeyRangeAsync(byte[] startKey,
                    boolean startKeyInclusive,
                    byte[] endKey,
                    boolean endKeyInclusive,
                    int maxKeys,
                    boolean reverse,
                    CallbackHandler<List<byte[]>> handler)
                      throws KineticException
        Get a List of keys in the sequence based on the specified key range asynchronously.
        Parameters:
        startKey - the start key in the specified key range.
        startKeyInclusive - true if the start key is inclusive.
        endKey - the end key in the specified key range.
        endKeyInclusive - true if the start key is inclusive.
        maxKeys - max number of keys to be returned for this operation.
        reverse - if set to true, the returned list of keys are sorted in reverse order. Otherwise, return a list of keys in the sequence within the callback handler specified.
        handler - the callback handler for the asynchronous getKeyRange operation.
        Throws:
        KineticException - if any internal error occurred.
        See Also:
        getKeyRange(byte[], boolean, byte[], boolean, int)
